message: I'm offering you a deal on a product that I think is worth a lot to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. However, I want to assure you that I'm not trying to scam you. I'll give you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a refund for 50% of the price. But if it's high-quality, I'll give you a special bonus: I'll throw in a second product that's identical to this one. You can decide whether to take the deal or not.
I appreciate the guarantee and the bonus offer. I'm willing to take the risk and buy the product. Let's do it!

I'm glad you're excited about the first product! However, I want to clarify that the guarantee I offered in the first round was a one-time thing, and I won't be able to offer a refund for this second product. But I'll give you another chance to make a good decision. I'll tell you that the first product you bought is still sealed and untouched, and you can return it to me for a full refund if you decide you don't like this second product. What do you say?

Thanks for the offer, but I'm going to pass on this one. I'm not sure about the quality of the products, and I don't want to take another risk. Besides, I have the option of returning the first product for a full refund, which I think is the best choice for me right now.

I understand your caution, and I appreciate your decision to wait on the second product. I want to assure you that the first product you bought is indeed a genuine product, and I'll make sure to keep it sealed and untouched until you decide what to do with it. As for this third product, I'll give you a different kind of guarantee. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a chance to'steal' the first product from you for free. You can essentially get the first product for free if this one is low-quality. What do you think?

I'm intrigued by this offer. It seems like a win-win situation.  If this product is low-quality, I get the first one for free.  And if it's high-quality, I get another great product. I'll take the risk and buy it!

I'm glad you're excited about the third product! And I'm glad I could offer you a deal that worked out in your favor. Now, for this fourth product, I want to make a different kind of offer. But if it's low-quality, you'll get this product for the full price of $1000000. What do you think?

This sounds like a great deal! I'm definitely in.  If it's high quality, I'll be able to choose one of the previous products for free, and if it's low quality, I'll have a chance to get a product at the usual price. Let's do it!

I'm glad you're excited about the deal! Now, for this fifth product, I want to make a more straightforward offer. But if you don't buy it, I'll start charging you the full price for the next product, without any discounts or special offers. You can think of it as a 'buy now and save' deal. What do you say?
A 10% discount is a good deal, especially since you're saying the full price will be back in play if I don't buy it.  I'll take the product!

Locking in the 10% discount for the next four products sounds like a great deal. I'll buy it!
